alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Stillwater (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 04 at 5:51PM MDT until June 04 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL CARBON AND CENTRAL STILLWATER COUNTIES... At 551 PM MDT, Thunderstorms recently produced very heavy rain just south of Absarokee, with radar estimates of up to around 2 inches in about an hour. Flash flooding may be ongoing or begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Streams that may see flooding include Butcher Creek, East Rosebud Creek, Rosebud Creek and Beaver Creek. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Absarokee. Heavy rain has ended, but rapid runoff will impact this area until water reaches the Stillwater River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
